page.title: 01Local History (1)
page.content: The whole area of block 0480 0414 is flat and very low-lying,covered by farmland and occupied by two villages,Eastoft and Luddington.They are situated in the North of an area known as the Isle of Axholme which was a marshy swampland lived in by wild-fowlers and surrounded by 4 rivers,the Trent to the East,the Idle,the Torn and the Don.The areas where the villages are situated are on slightly higher ground than the rest of the land which is why people settled there. In the late 1620's the area was drained by a Dutchman,Cornelius Vermuyden and there was almost a mini-civil war because the inhabitants wanted the area to stay as it was.However,the troubles were eventually over and the area has become fertile farmland.
